headline: Former GOP senator likely billed taxpayers for her private jet  while claiming it would save them money: report
author: Matthew Chapman
sentences: It is theoretically possible that this arrangement saved taxpayers money  but it likely did the opposite, according to the report: "The 2017 Trump tax cuts created astounding loopholes for executive jet owners, effectively turning private aircraft into flying tax shelters.

"When former Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) was asked on the 2020 campaign trail about the recently purchased private jet she was flying around Georgia, the former CEO and multimillionaire senator defended the expense as saving taxpayer dollars," reported Roger Sollenberger.

Loeffler's campaign filings had shown she personally spent $700,000 for travel  but they hadn't shown the recipient of the money was Intercontinental Exchange, a company owned by her husband Jerry Sprecher, who owns the New York Stock Exchange.

On Tuesday, The Daily Beast reported new details about the arrangement that former Sen. Kelly Loeffler (R-GA) used to travel on a private jet  and obscure the cost of it to taxpayers, even as she claimed she was saving the government money.

"Instead of saving taxpayer dollars on public flights, Loeffler was using an expensive private jet and, ultimately, saving money for her husbands company," said the report.
"In essence, Loeffler was paying herself to use the jet, billing taxpayers for the plane, and, at best, obscuring the paymentsand, at worst, just lying about them.
